Author: Magnus Grimeland

Author: Magnus Grimeland
Post Text: Itâ€™s hard to go out there, leave your pride behind, and hustle. Asking people for help.Â Asking people to be your customer. There are many examples of people who give up along the way and others who never do. Youâ€™ve got to believe in your product. Youâ€™ve got to hustle. You canâ€™t take no for an answer. If you get a no, youâ€™ve got to meet ten more people and get ten more nos. Itâ€™s something I had to learn. Itâ€™s an insanely important lesson you have to learn to succeed. I talk more about the lessons learned building Antler in my episode with the Capital Allocators with Ted Seides. Link to listen in the comments. #podcast #lessons #leadership #entrepreneurship

Author: Magnus Grimeland
Post Text: What does it take for entrepreneurs to succeed in the world today? Itâ€™s a nuanced question. The world faces more complicated and urgent problems than before. And the traditional ways of solving them are no longer enough. We need a new global infrastructure to back ambitious people solving the biggest issues of our time. I discuss all this and more with Ted Seides on the Capital Allocators podcast. Hear about my path to building Antler as well as our unique approach to building the critical infrastructure needed to move the world forward. It adds an exciting dimension when it comes to how startups can disrupt industries and solve the world's most pressing problems.With investments in ~400 startups yearly, Antler is the worldâ€™s most active angel and seed-stage investor, supporting #foundersâ€™ trajectories from day zero across the entire early-stage life cycle.Currently, ~20% of Antler portfolio companies are leveraging artificial intelligence to drive their ideas forward. Excited to see how that number continues to grow.

Post Text: Did you know data preparation and cleaning tasks represent over 80% of the time consumed in most Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning projects?Kelvin Aongola started investigating how to speed up this process as he entered the inaugural Antler Amsterdam program in May 2019.
